sections.heading: Negative Forms Overview
sections.content:
Negation in Japanese involves different patterns depending on what you're negating - verbs, adjectives, or nouns - and the level of formality. Understanding these patterns is essential for expressing what is not or what doesn't happen.

Basic negation patterns: Verbs: 〜ない / 〜ません い-adjectives: 〜くない な-adjectives: 〜じゃない / 〜ではない Nouns: 〜じゃない / 〜ではない Form varies by type Formality affects choice

children.heading: Two main forms
children.content: Casual negative: 食べない "don't eat" 行かない "don't go" Polite negative: 食べません "don't eat" 行きません "don't go" ない = casual/plain ません = polite Same meaning, different register

children.heading: い-adjectives
children.content: 高い → 高くない "expensive" → "not expensive" 面白い → 面白くない "interesting" → "not interesting" Change い to くない Regular pattern Simple negation

children.heading: な-adjectives
children.content: 静か → 静かじゃない / 静かではない "quiet" → "not quiet" 便利 → 便利じゃない / 便利ではない "convenient" → "not convenient" じゃない = casual ではない = formal Both common

children.heading: Using copula
children.content: 学生じゃない / 学生ではない "not a student" 日本人じゃない / 日本人ではない "not Japanese (person)" Same as な-adjectives じゃない vs ではない Formality difference

children.heading: Casual to formal
children.content: Most casual: 食べない、高くない、学生じゃない Standard polite: 食べません、高くないです、学生じゃないです More formal: 食べません、高くありません、学生ではありません Adjust to situation Match register Context determines

children.heading: Was not / didn't
children.content: Verbs: 食べなかった "didn't eat" 食べませんでした "didn't eat (polite)" い-adjectives: 高くなかった "wasn't expensive" 高くありませんでした "wasn't expensive (polite)" な-adjectives/Nouns: 静かじゃなかった "wasn't quiet" 学生じゃなかった "wasn't a student" Past tense added to negative なかった / ませんでした

children.heading: Existence negation
children.content: ある → ない "exists" → "doesn't exist" お金がない "have no money" 時間がない "have no time" Not あらない Irregular negative Common usage

children.heading: Functions like い-adjective
children.content: ない conjugates like い-adjective: Present: ない Past: なかった Te-form: なくて Conditional: なければ Adjectival conjugation Not verb conjugation Important distinction

children.heading: Not uncommon pattern
children.content: 行かないわけではない "It's not that (I) won't go" 悪くないことはない "It's not that it's not bad" Double negative = weak positive Softening statements Indirect expression

children.heading: を vs が with negatives
children.content: を often becomes が: 本を読む → 本を読まない (can use を) 本が読めない "can't read book" (が common) Context determines Both grammatically possible Nuance differs

sections.heading: ないで vs なくて

children.heading: Different functions
children.content: ないで: 食べないで "without eating" Instruction: "don't eat" なくて: 高くなくて便利 "not expensive and convenient" Reason: "because it's not..." Different uses Don't confuse Context shows meaning

children.heading: Asking negatively
children.content: 食べませんか "Won't you eat?" / "Would you like to eat?" 行きませんか "Won't you go?" / "Would you like to go?" Polite invitation Softer than positive Common pattern

children.heading: Negative adverbs
children.content: 何も〜ない "nothing" 何も食べない "eat nothing" 誰も〜ない "nobody" 誰も来ない "nobody comes" 全然〜ない "not at all" 全然分からない "don't understand at all" Must use with negative Complete the pattern

children.heading: Literary form
children.content: Modern: 食べない Classical: 食べぬ 知らない → 知らぬ 行かない → 行かぬ Literary/formal Set phrases Not daily speech

children.heading: Cannot
children.content: 食べられない "cannot eat" 行けない "cannot go" できない "cannot do" Negative of potential Very common Expressing inability

children.heading: Strong negation
children.content: 全く〜ない "not at all" 全然〜ない "not at all" 決して〜ない "never" 絶対に〜ない "absolutely not" Emphatic negation Strengthening denial Common intensifiers

children.heading: Don't do
children.content: 食べるな "Don't eat!" 行くな "Don't go!" Casual prohibition Strong/rough Use carefully Or: 食べないで "Don't eat" (softer)

sections.heading: ません vs ないです

children.heading: Polite negatives
children.content: Both polite: 食べません (more formal) 食べないです (casual polite) ません = standard polite ないです = conversational polite Both acceptable Slightly different feel

children.heading: Please don't
children.content: 食べないでください "Please don't eat" 行かないでください "Please don't go" Polite prohibition Respectful request Common pattern

children.heading: Isn't it?
children.content: 美味しくない？ "Isn't it delicious?" 行かない？ "Won't you go?" Seeking confirmation Casual questions Expecting agreement

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
sections.content: ❌ Wrong negative form ✗ 食べるない (wrong formation) ✓ Correct formation ✓ 食べない ❌ Mixing formality ✗ 食べないません ✓ Choose one level ✓ 食べない OR 食べません ❌ Forgetting ある exception ✗ あらない ✓ Irregular form ✓ ない ❌ Wrong particle after negative Context determines Both を and が possible Learn patterns Practice formation Understand context

children.heading: Real-life negation
children.content: 今日は忙しくない "Not busy today" 彼は学生じゃない "He's not a student" テレビを見ません "Don't watch TV" 分からない "Don't know / Don't understand" お金がない "Have no money" 全然面白くなかった "Wasn't interesting at all" 行きたくない "Don't want to go" できない "Can't do it" 日本語が上手じゃない "Not good at Japanese" 時間がありません "Don't have time" Various negations Daily usage Natural contexts Common patterns Essential expressions
